intro: Adonanthe coerulea, commonly known as the blue hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals, which are unique among hibiscus species. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Adonanthe coerulea blooms during the summer months, producing showy flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
